title: How to Become a Good Jump Shooter

steps.title: Bend your knees and square your shoulders to the basket.
steps.content: Bend your knees and square your shoulders to the basket. Always make sure you are balanced when shooting.

steps.title: Never jump to the side, forward or backwards (If you are not trying to).
steps.content: Never jump to the side, forward or backwards (If you are not trying to).

steps.title: Make sure that you're shooting the ball on the way up.
steps.content: Make sure that you're shooting the ball on the way up.

steps.title: That means your elbow is always pointed in the direction of the basket.
steps.content: That means your elbow is always pointed in the direction of the basket.

steps.title: Hold your follow-through until the ball goes through the hoop.
steps.content: Hold your follow-through until the ball goes through the hoop. All of the ball's momentum and spin should come from your wrist. The power for the shot is provided by your legs.

steps.title: The ball should be at its highest point 2/3 of the way towards the rim.
steps.content: The ball should be at its highest point 2/3 of the way towards the rim. When shooting, think of your shot as going up and out. The balance of the two is what makes a jump shot go in.

steps.title: Your hand should look like you are about to put it in a cookie jar.
steps.content: Your hand should look like you are about to put it in a cookie jar. This movement gives the ball backspin.

steps.title: B is for balance, E is for eye, E is for Elbow, and F is for Following through.
steps.content: B is for balance, E is for eye, E is for Elbow, and F is for Following through. Remember to always face the basket and be balanced.

steps.title: Never land facing the wall or have your feet pointing anywhere else than the rim.
steps.content: Never land facing the wall or have your feet pointing anywhere else than the rim.
